alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 10:03PM CDT until July 09 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Dodge City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Hamilton County in southwestern Kansas... * Until 100 AM MDT. * At 903 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northwestern Hamilton County This includes the following streams and drainages... Sand Creek, Cheyenne Creek, Arkansas River, East Bridge Creek tributary, West Bridge Creek, Spring Creek, East Bridge Creek, Plum Creek and Syracuse Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
